'''Eglamar''' was a major region in the [[Falas]], encompassing the entire [[Belegaer|sea]]-board from [[Cape Andras]] to the northwest all the way to the headland of [[Ras Mewrim]] in the southeast.<ref name=Egla>{{WJ|B}}, ''Sindarin'', pp. 379-80</ref> The region of Eglamar also included the [[Havens of the Falas|havens]] of [[Círdan]] at [[Brithombar]] and [[Eglarest]], the two most important cities of the [[Falathrim]].<ref name=Egla/>

Eglamar was also where [[Finrod]] built the tower of [[Barad Nimras]] upon the cape west of Eglarest, guarding against a potential naval attack by [[Morgoth]] - however, such an assault never happened.<ref>{{S|Beleriand}}</ref>

However, Eglamar is only named on ''[[the Second 'Silmarillion' Map]]'',<ref>{{WJ|Beleriand}}, ''Sheet 3 South-west'', p. 184</ref> which formed the basis for the [[Map of Beleriand and the Lands to the North|map of Beleriand]] in the published ''[[Silmarillion]]'',<ref>{{LR|A3}}, pp. 407-413</ref> though both Eglamar and Ras Mewrim were not labelled on the published ''Silmarillion'' map.

==Etymology==
The name ''Eglamar'' is in [[Sindarin]], meaning "Home of the [[Eglain]]". It consists of the prefixal form ''Egla-'' (from ''[[Eglan]]'', meaning "Forsaken Elf") + ''[[bar]]'' ("home").<ref>{{webcite|author=[[Paul Strack]]|articleurl=https://eldamo.org/content/words/word-416654487.html|articlename=S. ''Eglamar'' loc.|website=Eldamo|accessed=24 November 2023}}</ref>
